record.field: 1. How to arrange the display with the display with the position of the upright arrangement of items on the shelf.
2. Merchandise that is included in the category of large profits is called
3. Where are the impulse lines located?
4. Everything that includes ways of thingking, habits or psychological tendencies of consumers that influence consumer behavior that affects their behavior when shopping in stores is called.
5. There are two categories of best sellers in the turnover of goods in the store, one of which is an on going seller which means.
A. Products that routinely sell hard every year
B. Products that sell well when they're trending
D. Items that sell well during certain seasons
6. Goods that sell well are called.
7. Goods that are placed in strategic positions that are easily accessible by many visitors in the hope that passersby are moved to buy.
8. The following are weaknesses in arranging goods horizontally, except.
A. Customers have to go back and forth to find the goods they need.
B. Member impression of limited goods sold
D. The items that buyers see and reach are limited
9. The following are steps that need to be considered in optimizing the sale of best seller items, except _____
A. Make sure the best seller items are classified properly so that consumers can easily find them
B. Place best seller items in optimal positions so they are easy to find
C. Procure or prepare sufficient inventory to meet demand
D. Place items in a different main display position compared to other items
E. Ensuring best seller items are given a good price card and promoted
10. Merchandise displayed by type is the location of goods _____
11. If the goods are placed in the counter area to make it easier for the waiter to monitor closely so that it is also easy to provide information to consumers
12. Special line items are best placed in the _____ area
13. Referring to consumer logic in shopping, care products such as body care and hair care are placed close to, except _____
14. What is not included in the rules of vertical display technique is _____
A. Small things are put on top and big things are put on the bottom
B. The distance between the shelves and the gondola must be the same or the higher you go the smaller
C. The items arranged are the same product
D. The small items are arranged on the left and the big ones on the right
E. The color composition of the product must be considered so that it looks harmonious and pleasing to the eye
15. The product is not stacked, and must adjust to the color, size, price, so as to make the products on display attractive. This is a product arrangement condition called
16. Hot spot is a term used to indicate an area of ​​_____
C. With a moderate level of crowd
17. Kegunaan menata barang dagangan di toko yaitu _____
E. Products that have high profits
19. Goods that are cheap and placed in areas that are easy to reach, see and around the cashier where when buying without having to think much are called:
20. The view of consumers at a certain level on the shelves of goods is called:
22. A product display activity that serves to offer other products related to the newly purchased product is called
23. The following are procedures for displaying goods vertically, except _____
A. Placing items from top to bottom systematically
B. The price of goods is put from low to high price
C. Arrange merchandise according to type and classification
D. Items are arranged by size, from the smallest to the largest or vice versa
E. The price of goods is placed from the expensive to the cheap
24. What impulsive products are located near the cash register?
25. One line item placement must be _____
26. What is not included in the grouping of goods is _____
C. With a moderate level of crowd
E. Products that have high profits
29. What is not included in how to arrange goods in a store is _____
A. Pay attention to the front first
30. An item that requires technical explanation is called a:
